sen.j: 藤原 顕忠（ふじわら の あきただ、 昌泰元年(898年) - 康保2年4月24日 (旧暦)(965年6月1日))は平安時代の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadaakira (898 to June 1, 965) was a court noble in the Heian Period.
FUJIWARA no Tadaakira (898 to June 1, 965) was a court noble who lived in the Heian Period.
FUJIWARA no Akitada (898 - June 1, 965) was a court noble who lived in the Heian Period.

sen.j: 左大臣藤原時平の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) FUJIWARA no Tokihira.

sen.j: 父の早逝によって実権が叔父の藤原忠平に移ったことも影響し、承平 (日本)7年(937年)に参議に任官した時には40歳になっていた。
sen.e: Because of his father's premature death, the power was moved to his uncle FUJIWARA no Tadahira, which affected the promotion of Tadaakira, who became 40 when he was assigned to sangi councillor in 937.

Because of his father's premature death, power was transferred to his uncle FUJIWARA no Tadahira, which affected the promotion of Tadaakira, who was 40 years old when appointed Sangi councillor in 937.

Because of his father's premature death, power was transferred to his uncle FUJIWARA no Tadahira, which affected the promotion of Akitada, who was 40 years old when appointed Sangi (councillor) in 937.

sen.j: 以後、天慶4年(941年)に従三位中納言、天暦2年(948年)大納言、天徳 (日本)元年(957年)左大将、同4年(960年)に63歳にして右大臣に至る。
sen.e: Thereafter, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Chunagon in 941, Dainagon in 948, Sadaisho (General of the Left Imperial Guard) in 960 and Udaijin (Minister of the Left) in 960 at the age of 63.

Thereafter, he was promoted to Jusani (Junior Third Rank) and Chunagon in 941, Dainagon in 948, Sadaisho (General of the Left Imperial Guard) in 960 and Udaijin (Minister of the Left) in 960 at the age of 63.

Thereafter, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) in 941, Dainagon (chief councilor of state) in 948, Sadaisho (Major Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 960 and Udaijin in 960 at the age of 63.

sen.j: 謙虚で控え目な人柄であったといい、饗応に使う家の広さ、外出時における先払いの下人の数、また使用する食器の質など、万事において大臣としては異例なほど質素に振る舞った。
sen.e: Known to be a modest and low-keyed person, he lead an extraordinarily simple life for such a high ranking official as a Minister in every aspect of life including the size of a house used for entertainment of guests, the size of his entourage while he was out, and the quality of plateware in use.

sen.j: 顕忠が一族の中で唯一人、菅原道真の祟りを受けることもなく長命し得たのは、こうした慎ましさのたまものであると噂されたという。
sen.e: It is said that Tadaakira was the only member of the Fujiwara clan who lived long without being cursed by SUGAWARA no Michizane because of such a high level of humbleness and modesty he practiced in his life.
It is said that, because of his great humility and modesty, Tadaakira was the only member of the Fujiwara clan who lived long without being cursed by SUGAWARA no Michizane.
It is said that, because of his great humility and modesty, Akitada was the only member of the Fujiwara clan who lived long without being cursed by SUGAWARA no Michizane.
